parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Pain, grief, sorrow, affliction. Apparently a primary word; sadness.
